body_html: Something is very strange here; a profile shows that the backward pass is running IndexBackward (5ms) and torch::autograd::Add (10ms) plus a bunch of smaller kernels in a loop thousands and thousands of times. Which sounds like it's autodiffing the scalar version (walking one by one through indices) of something that should be vectorized?
body_text: Something is very strange here; a profile shows that the backward pass is running IndexBackward (5ms) and torch::autograd::Add (10ms) plus a bunch of smaller kernels in a loop thousands and thousands of times. Which sounds like it's autodiffing the scalar version (walking one by one through indices) of something that should be vectorized?
body: Something is very strange here; a profile shows that the backward pass is running `IndexBackward` (5ms) and `torch::autograd::Add` (10ms) plus a bunch of smaller kernels in a loop thousands and thousands of times. Which sounds like it's autodiffing the scalar version (walking one by one through indices) of something that should be vectorized?
